title: Why can't Anivia do double damage on dragon or baron with her E, if Ashe can crit them?
body: Since Ashe does crit damage to people affected by her slow debuff, why do debuff immune monsters like Dragon and Baron get critted by Ashe if they're not debuffed? Anivia can't do this, so why should Ashe?

replies.body: We should probably make her able to.
This is why repertoir is the best

> [{quoted}](name=RiotRepertoir,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=TlNlA4NQ,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-08-30T08:04:13.172+0000)
>
> We should probably make her able to.

The same way Yasuo's ult can work with any knockup, would it be possible to align all Freljord champion slows so that their effects work with one another?

As an example, Anivia's E would do double damage to an Ashe-slowed target, and Ashe would deal a first-hit crit on a Sejuani slowed target. Sejuani could E anyone that's been hit by Ashe's or Lissandra's slows.

Basically all 'frost' slow effects would be unified. Whether to include Iceborn Gauntlet and Frozen Mallet in there would be arguable.

When I first started work on Ashe early this year, this was actually part of my personal plan. I thought it would be pretty cool if all the champions with chilled / frost effects combo'd off each other. If I ever get a chance to put some time into it, I'd still like to go back to it.

I don't remember where but I'm pretty sure a Rioter said that they specifically made the choice not to allow Anivia's E damage work with other frost slows. Something about too much synergy IIRC.

Is there a reason Ashe was nerfed so hard? I get that she was too strong at killing towers. That nerf made sense. I get that she had too much damage, so the volley nerf made sense. I get that getting 5 stacks of Q with one volley was too strong, so addressing it in some way made sense. But now it's a little too frustrating to get 5 stacks on her Q while every stack falls off after 5 seconds. Yet more it also kept its 18 second CD at all ranks. It's powerful when you can unlock the fully stacked ability, but it's hard to unlock and underwhelming until then.  It needs a little bit of a buff IMO to make it easier obtain the 5 stacks more often, make <5 stack activations more rewarding, or give some power while stacking it.

Do you think it would be possible to buff her wall? I had an idea awhile ago that people liked where characters who "cheated" her terrain by a fat man dimension phasing belly tackle or a pair of vault smashing fists would be slowed by a Chilled debuff. This wouldn't apply to Nocturne/Malph/Rek ults, nor flashes. Just for champions who can cross over that wall and actually phase through it.

Then she can E the once who escape for double damage.

Exactly my point, i'm asking for all the 'cold/frost/chill' slows to work together when Freljord champs are concerned. It would be an indirect and situational buff to pretty much Anivia, Sejuani, Ashe, Braum, Nunu and Lissandra, with maybe Trundle, Olaf and Volibear too. These guys don't use 'cold' to slow people though so maybe i wouldn't make it work.

Volibear and Tryndamere use a fear, Trundle's Pillar of Ice could work, and Olaf just throws axes, but these 4 all benefit from building either Frozen Mallet and/or Iceborn Gauntlet to some extent.

Trynd doesn't have a fear, and Voli's fear only works on minions. Yes, you could classify Voli's slow as someone afraid of the big powerful roar coming from a giant polar bear, and Trynd's slow as a humiliating mock as to why you're running away from him. But, they are not actually fears in a mechanical sense.

Sorry, just wanted to clear that up.
